brief_summary.textblock: In communities with over 100,000 residents, to investigate the incidence and mechanisms of fall in elderly, and strategies of fall prevention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of recruitment until the end of the study, assessed up to 42 months (reported once per year)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of recruitment until the end of the study, assessed up to 42 months
secondary_outcome.description: During balance tests, assessing kinematics by using inertia sensors.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of recruitment until the end of the study, assessed up to 42 months
secondary_outcome.description: During balance tests, assessing kinetics by using sEMG (high-density surface EMG).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of recruitment until the end of the study, assessed up to 42 months
secondary_outcome.description: During balance tests, assessing brain mechanisms by using electroencephalogram (EEG).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of recruitment until the end of the study, assessed up to 42 months
secondary_outcome.description: During balance tests, assessing brain mechanisms by using functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of recruitment until the end of the study, assessed up to 42 months
secondary_outcome.description: Using functional magnetic resonance imaging to assess brain mechanisms during foot movements.

arm_group.description: Elderly people in the community who have no fall history
Elderly people in the community who have fall history

intervention.description: Elderly people with or without fall history receive exercise to improve balance. Exercise interevention will be given 6 months in 2020. Outcomes (incidence of fall and biological tests) between two arms will be compared.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- community dwelling adults without medical conditions to impair walking ability
Exclusion Criteria:
- cognitively or physically unable to cooperate with the examiner to finish the test
